intro: Mentha aquatica f. riparia, commonly known as water mint, is a hybrid form of the water mint plant. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist or aquatic environments. The plant features slender, square stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, pale blue or white flowers appear in whorls along the stem, and it is known for its strong, minty aroma. This variety is often found near streams, ponds, and other water bodies, where it thrives in wet soil conditions.
